info.description: Synology Calendar APIs enable seamless integration and management of calendar events within your business systems. With advanced features for event creation, editing, and scheduling, leverage REST APIs to build Synology Calendar customized scheduling functions to enhance coordination across platforms.{X-SYSTEM-REQUIREMENTS}
info.title: Synology Calendar

sid.description: Session ID required for subsequent API calls.

data.sid: your session id required for subsequent API calls

post.description: Sign in DSM to obtain `sid` which is required for subsequent API calls.

format.description: Session id return format. Set it to literal `sid` to ensure compatibility.

post.description: Sign out the DSM session corresponding to the specified `_sid`.

date_format.description:
Date format. Value: Possible formats using year, month and day
Y-m-d
m/d/Y
d/m/Y
d.m.Y
d-m-Y

default_plugin_mode.description:
Whether the default tab panel in the right sidebar of the Synology Calendar UI is the calendar list. Values:
nav_panel: Default is the calendar list
todo_plugin: Default is the task list

default_view.description:
Default calendar view. Values:
day: View by day
week: View by week
month: View by month
list: View by agenda

last_used_map_type.description:
Default map source. Values:
none: plain text
google: Google map
baidu: Baidu map

time_format.description: Time display in 12-hour format or 24-hour format. Value: 12 or 24

week_start_day.description:
Default day that is considered the start of a week. Values:
0: Sunday
1: Monday
6: Saturday

date_format.description:
Date format. Value: Possible formats using year, month and day
Y-m-d
m/d/Y
d/m/Y
d.m.Y
d-m-Y

get.description: Obtain user settings based on user's identity.

cal_id.description:
ID of the calendar where the event is located
Value: Possible formats can be "/admin/home/" or shared calendar "/test1/xxxxx/"

original_cal_id.description:
Original ID of the calendar where the event is located
Value: Possible formats can be "/admin/home/" or shared calendar "/test1/xxxxx/"

ical_uid.description: UUID of the event within ICS

dav_etag.description:
Event time stamp
If this value differs from the server's recorded value when modified, it indicates someone else has already changed it.

create_time.description: Event creation time in Epoch seconds

modify_time.description: Event modification time in Epoch seconds

color.description:
Event color
Value: RGB color code, e.g., #112233T
Leave empty to use the calendar's default color

is_all_day.description: Whether this is an all-day event

tz_id.description:
Partial-day events require time zone information.
Value: Run syno.cal.timezone for list of possible values, e.g., "Asia/Taipei"

dtstart.description: Event start time in Epoch seconds

dtstart_string.description:
Event start time (all-day and partial-day) in ISO 08601.2004
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000

dtend.description: Event end time in Epoch seconds

dtend_string.description:
Event end time (all-day and partial-day) in ISO 08601.2004.
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000

evt_ical.description: Full ICS content of the event

is_repeat_evt.description: Whether this is a recurring event

original_cal_id.description: Id of this calendar to its owner, the same as cal_id if the calendar does not share to others

is_all_day.description: Is this is an all day event

tz_id.description:
Partial-day events require time zone information.
Value: Run syno.cal.timezone for list of possible values, e.g., "Asia/Taipei"

dtstart.description: Start time of this event, e.g. "20190606", "TZID=Asia/Tokyo:20190628T090000"

dtend.description: End time of this event, e.g. "20190607", "TZID=Asia/Tokyo:20190628T100000"

color.description:
Event color
Value: RGB color code, e.g., #112233T
Leave empty to use the calendar's default color

parameters.name: recurrence_id

schema.description:
Dependent on evt_id, the date and time of the sub-event in ISO8061.2004
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000

parameters.description:
Dependent on evt_id, the date and time of the sub-event in ISO8061.2004
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000

cal_id_list.description:
ID of the calendar where the event is located
Value: Possible formats can be "/admin/home/" or shared calendar "/admin/test1--xxxxx/"

start.description: Event start time in Epoch seconds

end.description: Event end time in Epoch seconds

evt_color_list.description:
Event color to be listed, in RGB color code format.
Value: ["#112233", "#445566"].

keyword.description: Search string, a list consisting of the event summary, description, and location

filter_starred.description:
Is this event visible
Values:
yes: is visible
no: not visible
all: all events regardless of visibility

filter_own.description:
Did the event owner create this event.
Values:
yes: This event was created by the event owner
no: This event was not created by the event owner
all: All events whether it was created by the event owner

filter_invited.description:
Is this an invitation
Values:
yes: This was an invitation
no: This was not an invitation
all: All events whether this was an invitation or not

put.summary: Set an exclusive date for repeating events

dav_etag.description:
Event time stamp
If this value differs from the server's recorded value when modified, it indicates someone else has already changed it.

exdate.description:
Delete a specific occurrence within a recurring event in ISO 08601.2004
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601.
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000.

put.summary: Set specific properties of an event

recurrence_id.description:
Dependent on evt_id, the date and time of the sub-event in ISO8061.2004
Value:
All-day events: YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601
Partial-day events: YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000

cal_id_list.description: The calendar ID to which the task belongs. Value: Possible format is "/admin/home_todo/".

due.description: The timestamp of the due date, in Epoch seconds.

filter_complete.description: Completion status of the task. Values: "yes", "no", "all". yes: Only completed, no: Only not completed, all: Both completed and not completed.

filter_due.description: Presence of task due value. Values: "yes", "no", "all". yes: Must have a due value, no: Must not have a due value, all: Both with and without due values.

create_time.description: Creation time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

dav_etag.description: Timestamp of the task. If this value differs from the one stored on the server when modifying this event, it indicates that someone else has modified it first.

dtstart.description: Start time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

dtstart_string.description: Start time of the task. There are two formats: all-day tasks and non-all-day tasks. Primarily in ISO8601.2004 format. Values: For all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601. For non-all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000.

due.description: End time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

due_string.description: End time of the task. There are two formats: all-day tasks and non-all-day tasks. Primarily in ISO8601.2004 format. Values: For all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601. For non-all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000.

evt_cal.description: The complete ICS content of the task.

has_end_time.description: Indicates the presence of due. For tasks, due may be absent.

has_start_time.description: Indicates the presence of dtstart. For tasks, dtstart may be absent.

ical_uid.description: UUID of the task in the ICS.

modify_time.description: Modification time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

original_cal_id.description: Original ID of the calendar where the task is located. Values: Possible formats are "/admin/home/" or shared calendar "/test1/xxxxx/".

percent_complete.description: Completion percentage of the task. Values: 0 or 100

tzid.description: Timezone information is required for non-all-day tasks. Value: Possible format is "Asia/Taipei"

create_time.description: Creation time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

parameters.name: cal_type

schema.description: Type of calendar, values are event, todo or all

parameters.description: Type of calendar, values are event, todo or all

success.description: Indicate whether the request was successful.

error.description: Indicate the error if the request failed.

is_visible.description: Indicate the visibility of the event to specific users

active.description: The timezone is active or not

is_real_email.description: The email is real or virtual

has_set_email.description: The type of email of this user is set or not

type.description:
Recurrence settings
Values:
day: Recurring daily
week:Recurring weekly
month:Recurring monthly
year:Recurring yearly

interval.description:
Recurrence interval
Values: e.g., if type is set to day, and interval is set to 3, it means that this event will recur every 3 days.

weekday.description:
Used when the type is set as week, indicates which day of the week an event should recur on
Values: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday

week_start_day.description:
Used when the type is set as week, indicates the starting day of the week
Values: Empty, "Sunday", "Monday", "Saturday"

month_option.description:
Used when the type is set as month, indicates which day of the month an event should recur on
Values:
day_of_month: the day of the month, same day as dtstart
day_of_week: the week and day of the month, e.g., 3rd day of the 2nd month

create_time.description: Creation time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

dav_etag.description: Timestamp of the task. If this value differs from the one stored on the server when modifying this event, it indicates that someone else has modified it first.

dtstart.description: Start time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

dtstart_string.description: Start time of the task. There are two formats: all-day tasks and non-all-day tasks. Primarily in ISO8601.2004 format. Values: For all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601. For non-all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000.

due.description: End time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

due_string.description: End time of the task. There are two formats: all-day tasks and non-all-day tasks. Primarily in ISO8601.2004 format. Values: For all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDD, e.g., 20230601. For non-all-day tasks, the format is YYYYMMDDThhmmss, e.g., 20230601T080000.

evt_cal.description: The complete ICS content of the task.

has_end_time.description: Indicates the presence of due. For tasks, due may be absent.

has_start_time.description: Indicates the presence of dtstart. For tasks, dtstart may be absent.

ical_uid.description: UUID of the task in the ICS.

modify_time.description: Modification time of the task, in Epoch seconds.

original_cal_id.description: Original ID of the calendar where the task is located. Values: Possible formats are "/admin/home/" or shared calendar "/test1/xxxxx/".

percent_complete.description: Completion percentage of the task. Values: 0 or 100

tzid.description: Timezone information is required for non-all-day tasks. Value: Possible format is "Asia/Taipei"

action.description: The ACTION property in the ICS VALARM component.

description.description: The DESCRIPTION property in the ICS VALARM component. Default value can be "This is an event reminder".

type.description: Type of the alarm. Values: "duration", "datetime". duration: An alarm set for a relative time. datetime: An alarm set for an absolute time.

app.description: Name of the Synology app. Indicates which app the event was created from.

msg_id.description: Relevant ID required by the app.

related.description: Relative to dtstart or dtend. Values: "start", "end". start: Relative to the event's start time. end: Relative to the event's end time.

minutes.description: How many minutes before or after the event to trigger the reminder. Value: Minutes, can be positive or negative.

utc_seconds.description: When to trigger the reminder in UTC time. Value: UTC seconds.

key.description: The property key in the ICS.

value.description: The property value in the ICS.

parameters.description: List of parameters belonging to the ICS property.

key.description: The parameter key of a specific property in the ICS.

value.description: The parameter value of a specific property in the ICS.

type.description:
Used when the type is set as week, indicates the starting day of the week
Values: Empty, "Sunday", "Monday", "Saturday"

date.description: End date and time in Epoch seconds

map_type.description:
location data source
Values: google: Google map, baidu: Baidu map, Empty string: no source

place_id.description: Used by Google Map or Baidu map

type.description:
Event participants
Values: dsm: internal DSM user accounts, email: external email address

status.description:
Event participant's status
Values: needs_action: No response, accepted: Invitation accepted, declined: Invitation declined, tentative: May accept

role.description:
Event participant's role
Values: organizer: Event organization, attendee: Event attendee

user_name.description: Internal participant account name or external email address

is_real_email.description: Whether this is a valid email (limited to internal users)

is_syno.description: Whether this is an attachment uploaded by Synology Calendar

property_value.description:
Attachment contents
If is_syno is true

file_size.description:
Attachment size
If is_syno is True

value.description:
Parameter "VALUE" in ICS with the default of URI
Can be binary, indicating the property value format

encoding.description: Specifies the property's encoding format. If binary, possible value may be BASE64

main_event_dtstart.description: Start time of the main event in Epoch seconds

main_event_dtstart_string.description: Start time of the main event

main_event_dtend.description: End time of the main event in Epoch seconds

main_event_dtend_string.description: End time of the main event

repeat_index.description: A virtual index for recurring events, starting from 1.

cal_color.description: Color of calendar, use format like #FFFFFF

is_hidden_in_cal.description: Are all events in this calendar hidden on calendar view

is_hidden_in_list.description: Is this calendar hidden on calendar list

notify_import_cal_by_browser.description: Notify the result of calendar import by browser

notify_import_cal_by_mail.description: Notify the result of calendar import by mail

original_cal_id.description: Original id of this calendar

cal_public_sharing_id.description: Id of RO shared link of this calendar

is_set.description: Whether there is a reminder notification configured.

minutes.description: Default reminder notification time in minutes.

type.description:
Default task list types. Values:
selected_date: By day
upcoming: Starting from the current day and working backwards
by_list: Based on selected task list

extra.description: Only applicable when the type is "by_list", refers to the default task list number.

x-servers-description: Specify the connection to your Synology NAS.
x-security-description:
Please [Sign in](#post-/api/Calendar/default/v1/login) first to retrieve your sid.
Then, enter your `sid` in the field below using the following format: `id={sid};` to apply your session ID in the cookie header. Once you set the `sid`, it will automatically apply to all APIs.

/Support/resources.description:
Postman Testing Guide

API testing helps teams verify whether Synology Office Suite API endpoints, methods, and integrations function as expected.


Step1. Obtain the API Specification

Before testing an API, you need its specification, which outlines the available endpoints, parameters, and methods. Download the API specification for Synology Office Suite packages to explore their API capabilities.

  • Synology Drive
  • Synology Spreadsheet
  • Synology MailPlus
  • Synology Calendar
Step2. Import API Spec to Postman. Get started
Step3. Set Up Testing Environment for desired package
  • Synology Drive / MailPlus / Calendar
  • Synology Spreadsheet
ChatGPT

Enable the Synology Office Suite API plugin in ChatGPT to generate sample code for you and save your time and effort. Get started

/Support/resources/chatgpt.summary: How do I Chat with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT?
/Support/resources/chatgpt.description:
Purpose

Synology Office Suite APIs provide developers with powerful tools to automate workflows, enhance productivity, and securely integrate Synology data with third-party platforms through REST APIs and webhook support. To save you time and effort, you can enable the Synology Office Suite API GPT in ChatGPT. It can then search through the Synology Office Suite API documentation, extract relevant parameter formats, and generate sample code for you.

This article provides a guide on getting started with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT.


Environment
  • DSM 7.2.2 nano3 or above
  • Synology Drive 3.5.2 version or above
  • Synology Office 3.6.0 version or above
  • Synology MailPlus 3.3.1 version or above
  • Synology Calendar 2.5.3 version or above

Resolution
Start Chat
  1. Click this link to start chatting directly, or sign in to the ChatGPT website, and click on Explore GPTs in the upper left corner.

  2. In the search box, type in Synology Office Suite API.

  3. Select and hit Start Chat.

  4. You can now interact with Synology Office Suite API GPT. Select Keep in sidebar to save the GPT on top.

Example Prompts

Here are some example prompts that illustrate how to interact with the Synology Office Suite API GPT.

  • Automatically download new files uploaded to a shared folder on Synology Drive
    I have created a folder to which team members should upload their weekly reports. How to auto download new files uploaded to this folder?

/Support/contact-us.description:
Feature Request

Fill out the Feature Inquiry form and let us know what API you'd like to see implemented.

Community

Ask a question in Synology Community, or check if there is an existing discussion.

/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Synology Drive, MailPlus, and Calendar APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your NAS URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{apiKey}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to Body tab. Fill in account and password. Click Send to retrieve your sid.

  4. Copy the retrieved sid. Fill in the apiKey field in the format of id={sid}.

  5. The apiKey will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.

/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Spreadsheet APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your Spreadsheet API server URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{bearerToken}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to the Body tab. Fill in username, password, protocol and host for your NAS. Click Send to retrieve your token. For example, if the NAS URL is `https://my-nas:5000`, please fill in `https` for protocol and `my-nas:5000` for host.

  4. Fill in the bearerToken field with the retrieved token.

  5. The token will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.

/Support/resources/postman/import.summary: How to Import an API Specification and Start Testing with Postman
/Support/resources/postman/import.description:
1. Download and install the Postman API Platform by selecting the appropriate version for your operating system.

  2. In the workspace, click Import to import the API spec for the packages you need. If you haven't downloaded it yet, the links are available here

  3. Select Postman Collection and click View Import Settings to check the additional configuration options.

  4. Navigate to Folder Organization and ensure Tags is selected.

  5. Return to the previous page and click Import.

  6. Set up the testing environment for
    • Synology Drive, MailPlus, Calendar
    • Synology Spreadsheet
